properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 2:47PM PST until January 14 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
...ADDITIONAL SNOW EXPECTED MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING...

.Light high elevation snow will gradually diminish this evening,
with light accumulations possible above 3500 feet. However,
another round of light to moderate snow accumulations is expected
Monday through Tuesday morning. Snow level elevations will
fluctuate considerably throughout the event, likely from between
2000 to 3500 feet. Regardless, many local interior highways will
see snow accumulations in higher elevations, including Highways
299, 3, and 26. An additional, much stronger storm will also bring
heavier snow to the region Wednesday and Thursday.

* WHAT...Snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches possible Monday
through early Tuesday. The snow level will fluctuate between
2500 and 3500 feet in elevation.

* WHERE...Southern Trinity County.

* WHEN...From 1 PM Monday to 10 AM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will fluctuate considerably
during this event, ranging from roughly 2000 to 3500 feet in
elevation. Lowest elevation snow is expected overnight Monday
and Tuesday morning.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state of California can be
obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM MONDAY TO 10 AM PST TUESDAY
